actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to promote fair trade in auto parts, and for other purposes.
short_title: Fair Trade in Auto Parts Act of 1990

summary.text: Fair Trade in Auto Parts Act of 1990 - Requires the United States Trade Representative to initiate an unfair trade practice investigation under the Trade Act of 1974 with respect to: (1) the elimination of unreasonable Japanese trade practices that limit imports of U.S. auto parts and accessories; and (2) increasing access for such items to Japanese markets. Amends the Fair Trade in Auto Parts Act of 1988 to require the Secretary of Commerce to submit biannual reports to the Congress concerning increases in the sale of U.S. auto parts and accessories in Japanese markets. Directs the Attorney General and the International Trade Commission to study and report to the Congress on the pattern of procurement of such items by foreign automobile manufacturers operating in the United States to determine if there may be unfair methods of competition in connection with such procurement.

titles.title: Fair Trade in Auto Parts Act of 1990
A bill to promote fair trade in auto parts, and for other purposes.
